intro: Eriocaulon melanocephalum subsp. usterianum, commonly known as the black-headed spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, spike-like inflorescence and dark purple to black terminal bracts. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. This subspecies is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia.
